org_name: Volunteers of America of the Carolinas Inc
intake_process: Contact by phone at (803) 779-6465 or visit website for SSVF program intake. Veterans can call to inquire about eligibility and services. Referrals accepted from VA, VSOs, and self-referral.
service_area: 27 North Carolina counties: Alamance, Bertie, Caswell, Chatham, Durham, Edgecombe, Franklin, Granville, Harnett, Halifax, Hertford, Johnston, Lee, Martin, Nash, Northampton, Orange, Person, Pitt, Randolph, Rockingham, Vance, Wake, Warren, Washington, Wayne, Wilson

org_name: Asheville Buncombe Community Christian Ministry Inc
intake_process: Call SSVF program at (828) 259-5314 or email ssvf@abccm.org. Veterans can also call the Veterans Call Center at 855-962-8387 for homeless prevention and rapid rehousing services. Walk-in intake available at Cumberland Ave location.
service_area: Western North Carolina (28 counties from Charlotte to Murphy and Boone to Tryon): Buncombe, Burke, Caldwell, Catawba, Cherokee, Clay, Cleveland, Gaston, Graham, Haywood, Henderson, Jackson, Lincoln, Macon, Madison, McDowell, Mecklenburg, Mitchell, Polk, Rutherford, Spalding, Stokes, Surry, Transylvania, Watauga, Wilkes, Yadkin, Yancey

intake_process: Call main line at (843) 213-1798 or Veterans Services line at (843) 492-2594. Veterans can also contact through website for SSVF rapid re-housing and homelessness prevention services. Walk-in appointments available.
service_area: 13 northeastern South Carolina counties (Chesterfield, Clarendon, Darlington, Dillon, Florence, Georgetown, Horry, Lee, Marion, Marlboro, Sumter, Williamsburg, and York) plus 3 North Carolina counties (Columbus, Robeson, Scotland)

org_name: Community Action Partnership of North Dakota
intake_process: Contact local Community Action Agency in your region. Call (701) 280-0707 or visit www.capnd.org to find contact for SSVF representative in your area. Services available statewide through eight regional Community Action Agencies. Housing First approach with homeless prevention and rapid re-housing.
service_area: All 53 North Dakota counties served through 8 regional Community Action Agencies: Northwest, Northeast, Southwest, South Central, East Central, West Central, and Statewide programs

org_name: Northeast Nebraska Community Action Partnership Inc
intake_process: Call SSVF program at (402) 385-6300 or 1-800-445-2505. Veterans can request intake assessment for case management, rent/utility deposits, emergency supplies, transportation, and moving assistance. Walk-in appointments available.
service_area: Northeast Nebraska counties: Antelope, Boone, Cedar, Cuming, Dakota, Dixon, Dodge, Holt, Knox, Madison, Merrick, Nance, Pierce, Platte, Polk, Stanton, Thurston, Wayne (primary service area)
